definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.chinese: 用掉是另一个尴尬的用词。

sentences.english: This passage is to discuss the lexical characteristics of Business English.
sentences.chinese: 笔者将从词汇角度，略谈一下商务英语的用词特点。

sentences.english: He phrased his criticisms in careful terms.
sentences.chinese: 他的批评用词十分谨慎。

sentences.english: 96 of the 100 most common English words are Germanic.
sentences.chinese: 英语中100个最常用词中96个来自日耳曼语。

sentences.english: Maybe she can speak several dialects but she probably has very poor diction .
sentences.chinese: 莎莉说，也许她能讲几种方言，但可能用词不当。

sentences.english: Complication This paragraph was changed after Georgia objected to the original Franco-Russian phrasing.
sentences.chinese: 格鲁吉亚最初反对法俄的用词，这条随后作了修改。

sentences.english: This is so much about a word issue.
sentences.chinese: 这更多就是个用词的问题，我的意思是。

sentences.english: Olmsted wrote often and thought hard about the words he used.
sentences.chinese: 奥姆斯特德经常写作，往往费心思考自己的用词。

sentences.english: Sweat pores here is a generation term.
sentences.chinese: 汗毛孔在这里是一个代用词。

sentences.english: I really liked the tricks that Barth played with vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 我非常喜欢巴斯用词的花招。

sentences.english: They can also be created from the results of a frequent term extraction.
sentences.chinese: 它们也可以创建自常用词提取。

sentences.english: Please point out my mistakes and catachresis above. Thanks.
sentences.chinese: 我的英文有错误的，用词不好的请帮忙指出来，谢谢。

sentences.english: She niggled some expressions of my article.
sentences.chinese: 她对我文章的几处用词挑剔了一番。

sentences.english: Reference object is the necessary part of words builiding and words usage.
sentences.chinese: 参照体是构词和用词时必不可少的。

sentences.english: They can rigidify or help loosen up your thinking.
sentences.chinese: 用词可能僵化你的思维或者有助于放松你的思维。

definition: wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
pet phrase/regularly used expression/manner of speaking
